scripture.english: I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam

char1Panel.imagery: Staff raised or tablets in hand, radiant face (post-Sinai he wore a veil). The humble leader who spoke with God face to face. Perhaps kneeling in prayer for Miriam.
char1Panel.symbolism: The greatest prophet, most humble of men, intercessor for his sister

char2Panel.imagery: Timbrel in hand from the Song at the Sea, prophetess garb. Or shown in the moment of her leprosy, outside the camp, being prayed for by Moses.
char2Panel.symbolism: The prophetess who saved baby Moses, led the women, challenged her brother, was healed by his prayer

rivalryResearch.relationship: Moses and Miriam were siblings along with Aaron — the three leaders God sent before Israel. Miriam saved baby Moses by watching over his basket in the Nile. She led the women in song after the sea parted. But later, Miriam (and Aaron) spoke against Moses regarding his Cushite wife, questioning his unique prophetic status. God struck Miriam with leprosy; Moses prayed the shortest, most powerful prayer: 'Please God, heal her please.' She was healed after seven days outside the camp.

keyMoments.title: The Basket
keyMoments.description: Young Miriam watched over baby Moses in his basket among the reeds of the Nile. When Pharaoh's daughter found him, Miriam boldly approached and offered to find a Hebrew nurse — bringing Moses' own mother to nurse him.

keyMoments.title: The Song at the Sea
keyMoments.description: After the sea parted and Israel crossed, Miriam the prophetess took a timbrel and led the women in dancing and song: 'Sing to the Lord, for He has triumphed gloriously!'

keyMoments.title: The Challenge
keyMoments.description: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses concerning his Cushite wife. They said: 'Has the Lord spoken only through Moses? Has He not also spoken through us?' God heard.

keyMoments.title: The Leprosy
keyMoments.description: God's anger burned against them. When the cloud departed from the Tent, Miriam was stricken with leprosy, white as snow. Aaron begged Moses to intercede.

keyMoments.title: The Prayer
keyMoments.description: Moses cried out: 'Please God, heal her please!' (אֵל נָא רְפָא נָא לָהּ) — just five words, the most concentrated prayer. God commanded seven days outside the camp, then healing.

keyMoments.title: The Well of Miriam
keyMoments.description: Tradition says a miraculous well followed Israel through the wilderness for Miriam's merit. When she died, the well disappeared and the people had no water.

rivalryScenes.heroAction: Baby Moses floating in a basket among the reeds, or young Moses being nursed by his mother thanks to Miriam's quick thinking. The future leader, saved by his sister.
rivalryScenes.villainAction: Young Miriam hiding among the reeds, watching over the basket. Brave and clever, approaching Pharaoh's daughter with a solution. The sister who saved him.
rivalryScenes.scene: The Nile riverbank, papyrus reeds, Pharaoh's daughter and her attendants in the background. A moment of danger and salvation.

rivalryScenes.heroAction: Moses with staff raised, the sea still parted or closing on Pharaoh's army. Leading Israel in song, 'This is my God and I will glorify Him.' Male voices raised.
rivalryScenes.villainAction: Miriam with timbrel raised, leading the women in dance and song. 'Sing to the Lord, for He has triumphed gloriously!' Female voices answering. Parallel leadership.
rivalryScenes.scene: The shore of the Sea of Reeds after the crossing. Two groups singing — men with Moses, women with Miriam. Celebration of deliverance.

rivalryScenes.heroAction: Moses silent, humble, not defending himself against his siblings' words. The 'most humble man on the face of the earth' lets God answer. Dignified restraint.
rivalryScenes.villainAction: Miriam speaking against Moses, questioning his unique status. 'Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?' Perhaps with Aaron beside her. The moment before judgment.
rivalryScenes.scene: Near the Tent of Meeting. The divine cloud present. Tension between siblings about prophetic authority.

rivalryScenes.heroAction: Moses with hands raised in prayer, face anguished for his sister. Crying out: 'Please God, heal her please!' Interceding despite being wronged. The most humble man.
rivalryScenes.villainAction: Miriam outside the camp, stricken white with leprosy. Humbled, penitent. Waiting for healing and restoration. The prophetess brought low and lifted up.
rivalryScenes.scene: The camp of Israel with Miriam outside it, Moses praying toward her or toward heaven. The seven days of waiting.

player.name: Moses
player.attributeDescription: the staff that split the sea and struck the rock, or the tablets of the covenant, or face veiled/radiant from speaking with God
player.visualStyle: the greatest prophet, most humble of men, deliverer of Israel
player.clothing: simple robes befitting the most humble man — not ornate, dignified but not ostentatious. Perhaps a veil if post-Sinai.
player.physicalDescription: elderly but vigorous man with long white beard, radiant face (post-Sinai), eyes that have seen God. 'His eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated' at 120. Humble bearing despite immense authority.
player.archetype: The Prophet — spoke with God face to face, delivered Israel, most humble man

figure.name: Miriam
figure.attributeDescription: the timbrel she played leading the women in song, or associated with the miraculous well that followed Israel for her merit
figure.visualStyle: the prophetess who saved baby Moses and led the women in song
figure.clothing: prophetess robes in flowing turquoise and water colors, hair covered as appropriate for a leader of Israel's women
figure.physicalDescription: strong-featured woman with expressive eyes, dignified bearing of a prophetess. In youth: quick and brave. In age: wise and musical. Can be shown as young girl (basket scene), mature prophetess (song), or humbled/restored (leprosy).
figure.archetype: The Prophetess — saved Moses, led the women, challenged her brother, was restored through his prayer

connection: Siblings who led Israel together — she saved him as a baby, he prayed for her healing
